attributes.action: Opening State Single gender primary schools
attributes.additional_details:
Currently there are many state single gender grammer school having age-range 11+ years but there is not any single-gender state primary school for age-range 4-11 . 
There is only school classroom from where little ones get intraction or familarity to each other.
We residents of 'Milton Keynes'  do humbly request to allow separate girls and boys classes in primary schools.There are many independent single-gender primary school in England for age 4+ years but no state primary single-gender school.
attributes.background:
Little immature girls and boys should not study together in one small room with close distance. As such by free mixing of little boys and girls they become friends. We being muslim can't bear any friendship between boys & girls. We want single-gender
[girls-only and boys-only] state primary school.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. This is the responsibility of your local council.

You could raise your issue with a local councillor who represents you. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them:

https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors

Individuals and organisations are also able to set up new state-funded schools. You can find out more here:

https://www.gov.uk/government/get-involved/take-part/set-up-a-new-school
